channel.title: Cracked Minecraft Web-Applet/Launcher [need testers]
channel.description:
Well, as you may know about the cracking of the Launcher I did. (Well, its used alot of places atm). I have converted it into a web-applet (still gotta login, etc, for the crack to work).
I am looking for tested to make sure it will update on an un-paid account (i cannot load applets, but I have a friend and his friend playing right now).
Link: http://cuddlepups.net/mc-web/
Please, don't dis on the domain, I bought it for my mom who breed's dogs, she just hasn't done anything with it. Since I'm paying for it, I'm gonna use it lol. Also, just replace USERNAME with your wanted username lol. I will PM this to MITB if he would like the script and such, to host it himself.
Credit for editing/converting my HTML code goes to Muroth. (for game.php)

item.title: Cracked Minecraft Web-Applet/Launcher [need testers]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Alright, It seems the problem is when signing the JAR file. I wrote a small AppletLauncher that didn’t need to touch any of the cracked launchers (my working one) files. Put it in there, re-manifested and signed. Same error for me. I figured, well, maybe its the applet, so I since I had the manifest set to work with the regular LauncherFrame, I thought maybe it was the Applet that was giving the problem. The same error returned, so I am stuck believing it is the keystore that is the problem, since a signed version returns an error.

There are only 2 solutions I can think of at the moment.
[ul][li]Ripping apart Notch’s official keystore (i have the files if anybody knows how to)[/li]
[li]Launcher the cracked JAR from a seperate applet JAR via a URL. (I am not 100% sure this would even work, but in theory it would)[/li][/ul]

@FC - I will do percentages in the size after I can get this working. There is no point in changing the size of something and debugging the website if it isn’t usable atm.

Read full topic

item.title: Cracked Minecraft Web-Applet/Launcher [need testers]
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

It’s obvious to me that you just took the code from off of the Minecraft in browser. If you hadn’t already realized, you can’t just stick the .exe onto a site and make it work like that. The way you have “your” code set up it tries to read straight from directories that you don’t have.

[code]

body { background-image: url("dirt.png") } [/code]

Specifically look at:

Read full topic

item.title: Cracked Minecraft Web-Applet/Launcher [need testers]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:2, topic:393142”]All you need to convert anything that uses JFrame or similar is to change the start method to init(), and (usually) sign it. This would also be easy, but making it so that you can use GET to do something like
applet.php?username=??? and it will automatically load it for you would be pretty cool, like the IRC Chat tab does atm[/quote]
Actually, I am having it login. The issue I have, is the version on my Windows hdd was the old one that didnt work (didn’t know this). The HDD with Ubuntu on it went out 3 days ago (lost the working version, that i THOUGHT was a copy on windows). I am in the process of re-cracking the launcher, and then i’m going to re-convert.

EDIT: Why can’t i remove my own topic lol? Tried removing this after it was posted (since it turned out useless), and couldn’t.

EDIT2: I think I got it working (i cannot test it as even the official minecraft one doesn’t load for me, no applets do).

EDIT3: Got a working version to use a set user. Now the hard part (since idk php) is converting this so it works how I need it to.

<html>
 <body>
  <center>
   <head>
    <style>
     body {
 	    background-image: url("dirt.png")
 	}
    </style>
   </head>
    <applet code="net.minecraft.Launcher" archive="./mc.jar" width="854" height="480">
    <param name="separate_jvm" value="true">    
    <param name="java_arguments" value="-Dsun.java2d.noddraw=true -Dsun.awt.noerasebackground=true -Dsun.java2d.d3d=false -Dsun.java2d.opengl=false -Dsun.java2d.pmoffscreen=false -Xms512M -Xmx512M">
    <param name="userName" value="Player">    
    <param name="latestVersion" value="1303302694000">    
    <param name="downloadTicket" value="1d1d3888da375267c377de82a5e8ff99">
    <param name="sessionId" value="2095002344773593704">
   </applet>
  </center>
 </body>
</html>

Read full topic

@davidi2 wrote:

All you need to convert anything that uses JFrame or similar is to change the start method to init(), and (usually) sign it. This would also be easy, but making it so that you can use GET to do something like
applet.php?username=??? and it will automatically load it for you would be pretty cool, like the IRC Chat tab does atm
